doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Ralph Hirschtritt held on November 22, 1985
doc.abstracts: In November 1985, Ralph Hirschtritt was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his time associated with the World Bank, Mr. Hirschtritt worked as director of the office of balance of payments policy, options, and strategy at the United States department of the treasury, and he also worked as deputy to the assistant secretary for the treasury for international financial and economic affairs (1969-1972). He served as a liaison to the World Bank at the United States treasury. His transcript concerns the United States government and the World Bank, including the denial of the World Bank to float bonds in the country.
